intro: Phanera scarlatina, commonly known as the scarlet phanera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
